related_expressions.meaning: Said before eating (literally: I humbly receive)
Said after eating (Thank you for the meal)

cultural_tip: It’s customary in Japan to say “いただきます” before eating and “ごちそうさまでした” after finishing the meal.
grammar_note: “Taberu” is a ru-verb (also known as an ichidan verb). Its polite form is created by replacing ‘ru’ with ‘masu’.
